page.title: 13Shopping in Crawford.
page.content: In Crawford the shopping is good. Although there are only four shops, they are good shops.The Coach House is a craft shop selling a variety of craft goods.The Post Office sells all post office goods as well as groceries and general goods.Abraham's is also a general store selling mainly groceries.The Merlindale Cafe sells sweets and novelties.Once a week,on Wednesdays,the bank comes to Crawford from Abington. Most people in Crawford shop in the local shops.They also shop in Biggar,Lanark,Dumfries or Hamilton. In these towns there is a much wider variety of shops and supermarkets. Goods are generally thought to be cheaper in the towns compared to the village.
